metadata.title: CVE-2024-56688 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:sunrpc: clear XPRT_SOCK_UPD_TIMEOUT when reset transportSince transport->sock has been set to NULL during reset transport,XPRT_SOCK_UPD_TIMEOUT also needs to be cleared. Otherwise, thexs_tcp_set_socket_timeouts() may be triggered in xs_tcp_send_request()to dereference the transport->sock that has been set to NULL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-56688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
